definition: (completed action marker)/(modal particle indicating change of state, situation now)/(modal particle intensifying preceding clause)
to finish/to achieve/variant of 瞭|了[liao3]/to understand clearly

sentences.english: The mountain range has much high peaks and deep canyons. The scenery is very lovely.
sentences.chinese: 这条山脉有很多岑岭和幽谷，得意美极了。

sentences.english: These two kittens on this piece of double-sided embroidery look like real ones. They are really lovable.
sentences.chinese: 这幅双面绣上的两只小猫维妙维肖，可爱极了。

sentences.english: That night, the boy couldn’t sleep for disappointment.
sentences.chinese: 那天晚上，小男孩失望极了，翻来覆去怎么也睡不着。

sentences.english: It was so cold that we were all shivering.
sentences.chinese: 天气冷极了，我们全部打着哆嗦。

sentences.english: This must be a silk rug，it looks so gorgeous.
sentences.chinese: 这种是丝毯吧？它看上去真是华丽极了。

sentences.english: The ball he put over at the start of the second half at Hull was like Beckham in his prime.
sentences.chinese: 对赫尔城下半场刚开始他射进的入球像极了贝克汉姆。

sentences.english: Midas was overjoyed when he heard this.
sentences.chinese: 迈达斯听到这话，高兴极了。

sentences.english: My legs were tired with jumping and my face burned.
sentences.chinese: 我的双腿蹦得累极了，脸也冻得火辣辣的。

sentences.english: He felt very relaxed and very happy to be reading the papers .
sentences.chinese: 他现在只觉得舒身舒坦，读着报纸，真高兴极了。

sentences.english: The weather in my hometown is very pleasant .
Bruce was too thirsty; he drank two more glasses of water.
sentences.chinese: 布鲁斯渴极了，他又喝了两杯水。

sentences.english: Corn Corbett and Pasta is real bad. Over-cooked.
sentences.chinese: 玉米和意大利面难吃极了。

sentences.english: An old ivy vine climbed halfway up the brick wall.
sentences.chinese: 一棵老极了的长春藤攀在砖墙的半腰上。

definition: seems as if/rather like/Taiwan pr. [si4 de5]
to resemble/to be like/to look as if/such as/appearance/image/portrait/image under a mapping (math.)
indeed/truly/(coll.) (used to express disapproval, annoyance etc about sth)
very/completely/utterly/extremely/absolutely/hundred percent/to divide into ten equal parts
seemingly/apparently/looks as if/appear to be/gives the impression that/seems on the face of it to be
